intro: Allium panormitisi, commonly known as the Panormitisi garlic, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the island of Cyprus and is characterized by its bulbous structure and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
